headline: Enphase Energy (ENPH): Margin Gains Outpace Market, Challenging Cautious Growth Narratives
summary: Enphase Energy (ENPH) posted standout earnings this quarter, with net profit margins rising to 12.9% from 4.9% a year ago and annual earnings up 218.4% over the past year. This easily outpaces its five-year average growth of 3.3% per year. Looking ahead, EPS is expected to grow at 3.94% per year, while revenue is forecast to dip by 2.6% annually over the next three years. The strong improvement in margins and lack of flagged risks create a positive backdrop for investors, but a slower growth...

headline: Why Enphase (ENPH) Stock Is Nosediving
summary: Shares of home energy technology company Enphase (NASDAQ:ENPH) fell 14.6% in the afternoon session after the company provided a weak sales forecast for the fourth quarter and a downbeat outlook for early 2026.

headline: ENPH Q3 Deep Dive: Product Launches, Tariff Pressures, and Weak Forward Guidance Shape Outlook
summary: Home energy technology company Enphase (NASDAQ:ENPH) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 7.8% year on year to $410.4 million. On the other hand, next quarter’s revenue guidance of $330 million was less impressive, coming in 11.9% below analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.90 per share was 37.2% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Record Q3 Results and Cautious Outlook Could Be a Game Changer for Enphase Energy (ENPH)
summary: Enphase Energy recently reported third-quarter 2025 earnings, achieving record sales of US$410.43 million and net income of US$66.64 million, well above last year’s results, while also unveiling a comprehensive off-grid solar and battery solution designed to meet growing homeowner demand for energy independence. Despite the strong quarterly results, Enphase issued fourth-quarter guidance below consensus and cited tariff-related margin pressures and softening European demand as headwinds for...

headline: Enphase Energy Down 8% After Earnings
summary: Enphase Energy (NASDAQ: ENPH) delivered a sharp earnings beat on Tuesday afternoon, posting Q3 revenue of $410.4 million and non-GAAP EPS of $0.90, both well ahead of expectations. Enphase topped consensus by $37.3 million on the top line, a 10% beat that marks the company’s highest revenue in two years. Microinverter shipments reached 1.77 million ...
